data.text: Do not boast about what you will do tomorrow,
Do not praise yourself [MTY, PRS]; allow others to praise you.
It causes pain to our bodies to carry heavy stones or a pail full of sand,
It is cruel to be angry with others, and our being angry sometimes destroys others,
It is better to correct someone openly
If a friend criticizes you, he is a good friend and you can trust him;
When someone’s stomach is full, he does not want to eat honey;
Anyone who wanders far from his home/family
Putting olive oil and perfume on a person’s skin causes him to feel good,
Do not neglect your friends or your parents’ friends;
My child/son, cause me to be happy by becoming wise,
Those who have good sense will realize that there is something dangerous ahead, and they will hide;
You deserve to have your property taken from you
If you rise early in the morning and call out a greeting to your neighbor while he is still sleeping,
Having a wife that is constantly nagging
Trying to restrain/stop her from doing that is as difficult [SIM] as trying to stop the wind
We can use one iron tool to sharpen another iron tool;
Those who take care of fig trees will have figs to eat;
When a person looks in the water, he sees his own face;
It is as though the place where the dead people are is always wanting more people to die and come there;
Workers put silver and gold in a very hot furnace to burn out what is impure,
Even if you beat/crush a fool severely like [MET] you pulverize grain with a pestle,
Take good care of your flocks of sheep
because the money that you acquired from selling animals previously will not ◄last/stay with you► forever;
After you cut the hay [DOU] and store it to feed the animals in the winter while a new crop of hay is growing,
you will be able to shear the sheep and make clothes from the wool,
and you will get enough milk from the other goats
